title: Bankers' bonuses: No cap under Labour, says Reeves
description: The shadow chancellor has told the BBC Labour would not reinstate a bankers' bonuses cap that was scrapped last year by the Conservative government. It comes as Ms Reeves set out Labour's plans to boost economic growth through the financial services sector.

title: Irish unification 'within touching distance' claims Sinn Fein leader after DUP agrees return to Stormont

title: Norwich City Council should have control over homes repairs
description: Yet the council’s leaders have given up control by outsourcing repairs to an 'arms-length' private company - something that Green Party councillors are now trying to change. To be clear, there are many council homes that are in good condition ...

title: Tory plotters ‘poised to claim Sunak has betrayed Brexit’ with NI deal, sources say
description: The Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) in the early hours of Tuesday morning dramatically revealed it had agreed a deal with the Government to end its boycott of Stormont institutions over the so-called Irish Sea trade border created by Brexit. The details are not due to be revealed until Wednesday.

title: Queen frontman Adam Lambert is confirmed to headline Sydney's 2024 Gay And Lesbian Mardi Gras
description: Queen frontman Adam Lambert will headline the 2024 Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras Party. American singer Cece Peniston shared the news to Instagram on Friday when she revealed the line-up on her social media.

title: Caroline Lucas: Create ‘firewall’ between politicians and fossil fuel industry

title: Caroline Lucas: Create ‘firewall’ between politicians and fossil fuel industry
description: The MP for Brighton, Pavilion warned of a “revolving door” between parliamentarians and ministers and fossil fuel companies.

title: Labour vows to cut financial ‘red tape’ and ‘unashamedly champion’ UK sector
description: Report shows Labour move to scrap many rules and processes as party denies plan will dilute consumer protections

title: Rachel Reeves says Labour would ‘unashamedly champion’ the City
description: Shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves has vowed to “unashamedly champion” Britain’s financial services sector if Labour wins the general election, denouncing politicians who have been “embarrassed” by the City’s success.

title: LIVE: DUP backs deal to return to Stormont as NI Secretary says 'all conditions now in place'
description: Northern Ireland Secretary Chris Heaton-Harris believes 'all the conditions are now in place' for Stormont to return

title: Sinn Fein claims Irish reunification is 'within touching distance' after DUP ends Stormont deadlock
description: The reunification of Ireland is within “touching distance”, Sinn Fein has claimed, after the DUP ended its two-year boycott of Stormont over post-Brexit trading arrangements.

title: Green lane element of the Windsor Framework ‘will go’, says DUP leader

title: DUP deal: 'Green lane will go and goods will flow freely'
description: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson says the green lane proposed as part of post-Brexit rules for goods flowing between Great Britain and Northern Ireland "will go" as part of its deal with the government. On Monday, the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) endorsed a deal to restore power sharing after a 23-month absence.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene claims Mayorkas impeachment will pass in House
description: Georgia Republican Rep Marjorie Taylor Greene said she believes that the impeachment of Alejandro Mayorkas, the Homeland Security Secretary, will pass the House — even without any support from Democrats.
